intro: Tremastelma palaestinum, commonly known as the Palestine starwort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
